newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Euroyen, JGBs slip on Sakakibara comments.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Euroyen, JGBs slip on Sakakibara comments.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen and Japanese government bond (JGB) futures came under pressure from comments by key Japanese Finance Ministry official Eisuke Sakakibara in late Friday trade.
Sakakibara was quoted as saying the Bank of Japan (BOJ) could be expected to hike the discount rate by 0.50 percent in the coming year.

"The discount rate is currently very low. It it rises by 0.50 percent, it will be at 1.0 percent, which remains low. A move on such a scale should be expected in the coming year," he told the French afternoon daily, Le Monde, in an interview.
Sakakibara also said the BOJ would not hike rates until it was sure of an economic upturn.
Dealers said the comments caused a slight sell-off in a market which was already depressed by the dollar's strength against the yen and the resilience of Tokyo stocks on Friday.

But the impact was contained by the absence of Tokyo players and the fact that the market was already relatively short after heavy unloading earlier this week when a senior BOJ official said the central bank was mulling the timing of a rate rise.
The lead December Euroyen contract was quoted at an intra-day low of 98.86 at 1115 GMT against its IMM close at 98.90. June JGBs ended at 123.48 against a previous 123.95.
"We could see another round of selling on Monday. Most of the Japanese are out now and the Londoners are the only ones reacting," a trader with a Japanese futures house said.
He said December Euroyen could fall sharply to 98.81 if it breached the 98.85 level. June JGBs were expected to target the 123.00 psychological support.
Eurodollar futures ended little changed ahead of an abbreviated session and a long weekend in Chicago.
"I'm still looking to sell Eurodollars on any rallies because the U.S. is definitely going to hike rates again," the trader said.
He said he would sell the December contract anywhere above 93.750. It ended at 93.725 against its IMM close at 93.710 on light volume of 5,086 lots.
